speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in LEONTES' palace.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Enter LEONTES, CLEOMENES, DION, PAULINA, and Servants

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Sir, you have done enough, and have perform'd

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: A saint-like sorrow: no fault could you make,

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Which you have not redeem'd; indeed, paid down

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: More penitence than done trespass: at the last,

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Do as the heavens have done, forget your evil;

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: With them forgive yourself.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Whilst I remember

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Her and her virtues, I cannot forget

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My blemishes in them, and so still think of

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The wrong I did myself; which was so much,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That heirless it hath made my kingdom and

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Destroy'd the sweet'st companion that e'er man

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Bred his hopes out of.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: True, too true, my lord:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: If, one by one, you wedded all the world,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Or from the all that are took something good,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To make a perfect woman, she you kill'd

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Would be unparallel'd.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I think so. Kill'd!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: She I kill'd! I did so: but thou strikest me

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Sorely, to say I did; it is as bitter

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Upon thy tongue as in my thought: now, good now,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Say so but seldom.

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Not at all, good lady:

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: You might have spoken a thousand things that would

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Have done the time more benefit and graced

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Your kindness better.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You are one of those

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Would have him wed again.

speaker: DION
text_entry: If you would not so,

speaker: DION
text_entry: You pity not the state, nor the remembrance

speaker: DION
text_entry: Of his most sovereign name; consider little

speaker: DION
text_entry: What dangers, by his highness' fail of issue,

speaker: DION
text_entry: May drop upon his kingdom and devour

speaker: DION
text_entry: Incertain lookers on. What were more holy

speaker: DION
text_entry: Than to rejoice the former queen is well?

speaker: DION
text_entry: What holier than, for royalty's repair,

speaker: DION
text_entry: For present comfort and for future good,

speaker: DION
text_entry: To bless the bed of majesty again

speaker: DION
text_entry: With a sweet fellow to't?

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: There is none worthy,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Respecting her that's gone. Besides, the gods

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Will have fulfill'd their secret purposes;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: For has not the divine Apollo said,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Is't not the tenor of his oracle,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: That King Leontes shall not have an heir

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Till his lost child be found? which that it shall,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Is all as monstrous to our human reason

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As my Antigonus to break his grave

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And come again to me; who, on my life,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Did perish with the infant. 'Tis your counsel

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: My lord should to the heavens be contrary,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Oppose against their wills.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To LEONTES

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Care not for issue;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The crown will find an heir: great Alexander

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Left his to the worthiest; so his successor

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Was like to be the best.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Good Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Who hast the memory of Hermione,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I know, in honour, O, that ever I

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Had squared me to thy counsel! then, even now,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I might have look'd upon my queen's full eyes,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Have taken treasure from her lips--

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And left them

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: More rich for what they yielded.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou speak'st truth.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: No more such wives; therefore, no wife: one worse,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And better used, would make her sainted spirit

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Again possess her corpse, and on this stage,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where we're offenders now, appear soul-vex'd,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And begin, 'Why to me?'

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Had she such power,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: She had just cause.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: She had; and would incense me

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To murder her I married.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I should so.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Were I the ghost that walk'd, I'ld bid you mark

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Her eye, and tell me for what dull part in't

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You chose her; then I'ld shriek, that even your ears

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Should rift to hear me; and the words that follow'd

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Should be 'Remember mine.'

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Stars, stars,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And all eyes else dead coals! Fear thou no wife;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I'll have no wife, Paulina.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Will you swear

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Never to marry but by my free leave?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Never, Paulina; so be blest my spirit!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Then, good my lords, bear witness to his oath.

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: You tempt him over-much.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Unless another,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As like Hermione as is her picture,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Affront his eye.

speaker: CLEOMENES
text_entry: Good madam,--

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I have done.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Yet, if my lord will marry,--if you will, sir,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: No remedy, but you will,--give me the office

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To choose you a queen: she shall not be so young

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As was your former; but she shall be such

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As, walk'd your first queen's ghost,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: it should take joy

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To see her in your arms.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My true Paulina,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: We shall not marry till thou bid'st us.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: That

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Shall be when your first queen's again in breath;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Never till then.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: One that gives out himself Prince Florizel,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Son of Polixenes, with his princess, she

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The fairest I have yet beheld, desires access

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: To your high presence.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What with him? he comes not

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Like to his father's greatness: his approach,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So out of circumstance and sudden, tells us

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: 'Tis not a visitation framed, but forced

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: By need and accident. What train?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: But few,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And those but mean.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: His princess, say you, with him?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Ay, the most peerless piece of earth, I think,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That e'er the sun shone bright on.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: O Hermione,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As every present time doth boast itself

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Above a better gone, so must thy grave

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Give way to what's seen now! Sir, you yourself

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Have said and writ so, but your writing now

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Is colder than that theme, 'She had not been,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Nor was not to be equall'd;'--thus your verse

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Flow'd with her beauty once: 'tis shrewdly ebb'd,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: To say you have seen a better.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Pardon, madam:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The one I have almost forgot,--your pardon,--

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The other, when she has obtain'd your eye,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Will have your tongue too. This is a creature,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Would she begin a sect, might quench the zeal

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Of all professors else, make proselytes

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Of who she but bid follow.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: How! not women?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Women will love her, that she is a woman

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: More worth than any man; men, that she is

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The rarest of all women.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Go, Cleomenes;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Yourself, assisted with your honour'd friends,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Bring them to our embracement. Still, 'tis strange

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exeunt CLEOMENES and others

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: He thus should steal upon us.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Had our prince,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Jewel of children, seen this hour, he had pair'd

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Well with this lord: there was not full a month

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Between their births.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Prithee, no more; cease; thou know'st

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: He dies to me again when talk'd of: sure,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: When I shall see this gentleman, thy speeches

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Will bring me to consider that which may

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Unfurnish me of reason. They are come.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Re-enter CLEOMENES and others, with FLORIZEL and PERDITA

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Your mother was most true to wedlock, prince;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For she did print your royal father off,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Conceiving you: were I but twenty-one,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Your father's image is so hit in you,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: His very air, that I should call you brother,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As I did him, and speak of something wildly

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: By us perform'd before. Most dearly welcome!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And your fair princess,--goddess!--O, alas!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I lost a couple, that 'twixt heaven and earth

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Might thus have stood begetting wonder as

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: You, gracious couple, do: and then I lost--

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: All mine own folly--the society,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Amity too, of your brave father, whom,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Though bearing misery, I desire my life

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Once more to look on him.

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: By his command

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Have I here touch'd Sicilia and from him

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Give you all greetings that a king, at friend,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Can send his brother: and, but infirmity

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Which waits upon worn times hath something seized

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: His wish'd ability, he had himself

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: The lands and waters 'twixt your throne and his

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Measured to look upon you; whom he loves--

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: He bade me say so--more than all the sceptres

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: And those that bear them living.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: O my brother,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Good gentleman! the wrongs I have done thee stir

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Afresh within me, and these thy offices,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So rarely kind, are as interpreters

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of my behind-hand slackness. Welcome hither,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As is the spring to the earth. And hath he too

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exposed this paragon to the fearful usage,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: At least ungentle, of the dreadful Neptune,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To greet a man not worth her pains, much less

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The adventure of her person?

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: She came from Libya.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where the warlike Smalus,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That noble honour'd lord, is fear'd and loved?

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Most royal sir, from thence; from him, whose daughter

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: His tears proclaim'd his, parting with her: thence,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: A prosperous south-wind friendly, we have cross'd,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: To execute the charge my father gave me

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: For visiting your highness: my best train

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: I have from your Sicilian shores dismiss'd;

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Who for Bohemia bend, to signify

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Not only my success in Libya, sir,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: But my arrival and my wife's in safety

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Here where we are.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The blessed gods

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Purge all infection from our air whilst you

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Do climate here! You have a holy father,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A graceful gentleman; against whose person,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So sacred as it is, I have done sin:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For which the heavens, taking angry note,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Have left me issueless; and your father's blest,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As he from heaven merits it, with you

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Worthy his goodness. What might I have been,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Might I a son and daughter now have look'd on,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Such goodly things as you!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Enter a Lord

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Most noble sir,

speaker: Lord
text_entry: That which I shall report will bear no credit,

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Were not the proof so nigh. Please you, great sir,

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Bohemia greets you from himself by me;

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Desires you to attach his son, who has--

speaker: Lord
text_entry: His dignity and duty both cast off--

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Fled from his father, from his hopes, and with

speaker: Lord
text_entry: A shepherd's daughter.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where's Bohemia? speak.

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Here in your city; I now came from him:

speaker: Lord
text_entry: I speak amazedly; and it becomes

speaker: Lord
text_entry: My marvel and my message. To your court

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Whiles he was hastening, in the chase, it seems,

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Of this fair couple, meets he on the way

speaker: Lord
text_entry: The father of this seeming lady and

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Her brother, having both their country quitted

speaker: Lord
text_entry: With this young prince.

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Camillo has betray'd me;

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Whose honour and whose honesty till now

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Endured all weathers.

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Lay't so to his charge:

speaker: Lord
text_entry: He's with the king your father.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Who? Camillo?

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Camillo, sir; I spake with him; who now

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Has these poor men in question. Never saw I

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Wretches so quake: they kneel, they kiss the earth;

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Forswear themselves as often as they speak:

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Bohemia stops his ears, and threatens them

speaker: Lord
text_entry: With divers deaths in death.

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: O my poor father!

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: The heaven sets spies upon us, will not have

speaker: PERDITA
text_entry: Our contract celebrated.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: You are married?

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: We are not, sir, nor are we like to be;

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: The stars, I see, will kiss the valleys first:

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: The odds for high and low's alike.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My lord,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is this the daughter of a king?

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: She is,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: When once she is my wife.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That 'once' I see by your good father's speed

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Will come on very slowly. I am sorry,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Most sorry, you have broken from his liking

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where you were tied in duty, and as sorry

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Your choice is not so rich in worth as beauty,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That you might well enjoy her.

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Dear, look up:

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Though Fortune, visible an enemy,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Should chase us with my father, power no jot

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Hath she to change our loves. Beseech you, sir,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Remember since you owed no more to time

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Than I do now: with thought of such affections,

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: Step forth mine advocate; at your request

speaker: FLORIZEL
text_entry: My father will grant precious things as trifles.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Would he do so, I'ld beg your precious mistress,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Which he counts but a trifle.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Sir, my liege,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Your eye hath too much youth in't: not a month

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: 'Fore your queen died, she was more worth such gazes

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Than what you look on now.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I thought of her,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Even in these looks I made.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To FLORIZEL

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: But your petition

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is yet unanswer'd. I will to your father:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Your honour not o'erthrown by your desires,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I am friend to them and you: upon which errand

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I now go toward him; therefore follow me

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And mark what way I make: come, good my lord.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exeunt
